Creating the Fractal Key requires a Rare forge and the following components:
• [Animus] from a Fractal Lepidoptera. • [Bones] of any Rare creature.

item.name: Monster Harvesting Tools
item.text:
The toolkit provides everything characters need to extract animus and preserve any creature parts. This kit contains skinning knives, a cleaver, syringes, a hammer, scissors, scalpels, a bone saw, hooks, as well as vials, watertight containers, binding reagents, and wrappings.
Harvesting Components: Characters may harvest and preserve Components from the corpse of a slain creature using monster harvesting tools. Harvesting monster components or extracting its animus must begin within ten minutes of its death. After this time, the magical energy within fades and the animus passes to the ether, and any remaining Components are no longer usable for creating magic items. No ability checks are required to successfully harvest monsters or extract an animus. As long as a character has the time and tools, they always successfully collect one monster Component from a creature's corpse. The toolkit provides everything a character needs to extract and preserve parts from any creature.
Monster Components: When the characters decide to harvest a monster's corpse, the Game Master determines which Components can be harvested from a monster, if any. In this book, each monster entry lists the Components available from that creature.
Component Rarity: The rarity of all parts are determined by the CR of the monster as presented by the table earlier in this chapter. Most item recipes call for Components with the same rarity as the item itself. However, some recipes may call for a component from a specific named monster, such as a Frost Giant, an Ancient Red Dragon, or a Banshee. In such cases, if no part of the presented rarity is available for a monster of that type, the DM should allow a component of a lower rarity to be used. For example, the ghost site bow is a Very Rare item that requires the bones of a Dryad and the hair of a Banshee. In this case, these components require you to find any Dryad or Banshee and do not require the parts to be Very Rare.
Component Categories: Each Component belongs to one of the following categories:
• Animus. This special Component is described below. • Bones. This includes the skull, spine, or the stem of a plant monster. • Dust. Detritus left behind by magical creatures or undead. • Fluid. Usually monster blood, and also ectoplasm, sap, or mucus. • Hair. Any fur or feathers. • Hide. Includes the monster's skin, scales, carapace, bark, or plates. • Natural Weapons. Almost any natural weapon from the monster's game statistics, such as teeth, claws, horns, tentacles, etc. • Organs. A broad category including both internal body parts and sensory organs, such as the heart, brain, glands, eyes, or guts.
Magical Animus: In the world of Drakkenheim, magic items are created by imbuing a physical object with a metaphysical animus. This vital energy must be properly extracted from a magical creature. A creature's animus is formed from the latent magical energy held within its body, but it is distinct from a creature's soul. Aberrations, Celestials, Constructs, Dragons, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, Giants, Monstrosities, Plants, Oozes, and Undead all possess a magical animus. Beasts and Humanoids typically do not possess an animus. When a creature is slain, its animus lingers momentarily before fading into the ether. However, a creature's animus can be collected and contained within a vessel of some kind, which is then used to make a magical item. It is impossible to extract the animus of a creature without killing it. Creating magic items requires the animus of one or more suitably powerful creatures. However, some magic items may call for a specific type of animus, such as the animus of a fey creature or dragon. In rare cases, a magic item may require the animus of a much more specific monster. Animus Vessels. An animus must be collected and stored in a specially prepared magical vessel. Traditionally, these vessels were minor magic items in their own right: often rune-etched gemstones infused with magic and created in a laborious process. However, the world of Drakkenheim was transformed by the arrival of delerium: the eldritch crystals function as suitable vessels in their raw state. A delerium crystal filled with magical animus glows with a brilliant octarine light, similar to how the crystals resonate with energy when exposed to magic. Creating Animus Vessels. An animus vessel can be created in 1 hour by combining any three other components of the same rarity. The resulting vessel can then be used as a vessel for an animus of the corresponding rarity. For example, an animus made from three Rare components can hold a Rare animus.
Animus Vessel Crystal Sizes Animus Rarity | Required Delerium Crystal Size Common | Chip Uncommon | Fragment Rare | Shard Very Rare | Crystal Legendary | Geode
Harvest and Extraction Time. Once started, collecting Components or animus takes ten minutes of work. During this time, the character must remain within 5 feet of the corpse. If the process is interrupted, harvesting must resume within ten minutes, or the Components are lost. A player character may only harvest Components from one creature at a time, regardless of its size. Several characters can work together to harvest multiple parts from the same corpse. No matter how many characters harvest a single corpse, they must all spend ten minutes harvesting.
Collector's Choice Each character may harvest one component from a creature's corpse per encounter. Characters can work together to harvest several different parts from one monster, or they may split up and harvest parts from several creatures at once. A monster's body usually provides only one of each available part, so two characters harvesting parts from the same corpse must choose to collect different parts, unless the Game Master determines that the creature's unique physiology allows the collection of multiples of the same part. For example, a Game Master might allow both horns from a Minotaur to be harvested, but it would take the work of two characters to collect both. Other parts may be more abstract in quantity: it's enough to know that the characters collected a bag of dragon fangs or a vial of troll blood without worrying about a specific measurement. When the player characters decide to butcher a carcass for Components, the Game Master lists all the possible Components available from the body. Each character may then choose one Component to collect. All other Components are lost and unusable, either because they were damaged in battle, ruined in the harvesting process, or deemed of unsuitable quality for magic item crafting.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 378 (Third Party)

item.name: Amulet of Incineration
item.text:
Crafted from a gem made from the elemental dust of an entropic flame set within a bone talisman, and glazed in the blood of an aberration, this amulet shimmers with an internal, ever-burning fire. Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals Fire damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt Fire damage by the spell to gain the Burning (3d6 Fire) condition.
Crafting. Creating an Amulet of Incineration requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from an Elemental • [Bones] Spine from a Monstrosity • [Dust] Elemental Dust from an Entropic Flame • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Amulet of Primal Wisdom
item.text:
Crafted from the dried leaves of magical plants and imbued with their dust, this amulet is decorated with a singular dried flower and then encased in sap. The pendant glows softly with the light of springtime and smells of floral fields in bloom. Your Wisdom score is 19 while you wear this magic amulet. It has no effect on you if your Wisdom is 19 or higher without it.
Crafting. Creating an Amulet of Primal Wisdom requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Plant Animus • [Dust] Plant Dust • [Fluid] Sap • [Hair] Leaves • [Organ] Flower
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Aqua Delerium
item.text:
This purple potion glows dimly with octarine light. It swirls and sparkles in its small, stoppered bottle. When you drink this potion, you regain expended spell slots. Roll 1d6. You choose spell slots to regain which have a combined level equal to or less than the result. None of the slots can be higher than level 5. For one hour after drinking Aqua Delerium, roll 1d20 each time you cast a spell of level 1 or higher. On a 1, you trigger a random Arcane Anomaly. If you consume more than one dose of aqua delerium before finishing a Long Rest, you take 1d12 Necrotic damage for each spell slot level regained from the second dose, and your Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until you finish a Long Rest. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. When a creature who cannot cast spells using spell slots drinks Aqua Delerium, it takes 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage and gains one level of Contamination.
Crafting. Creating Aqua Delerium requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organ] Any Glands
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Aqua Expurgo
item.text:
This bright orange fluid is stored in a syringe and charged with arcane magic. You can use a Utilize action to administer the shot directly to the heart of yourself or another willing creature. You are protected against Contamination for six hours after receiving a dose of Aqua Expurgo. During this time, whenever you fail a saving throw against an effect which would cause you to gain one or more Contamination levels, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this ability three times, after which the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire. If the effects of Aqua Expurgo expire in this manner, you immediately take 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage and become Incapacitated for 1 minute while you violently retch corrupt bile. Your Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until you finish a Long Rest. You die if this effect reduces your Hit Point maximum to 0. The Necrotic damage can't be reduced or prevented by any means.
Crafting. Creating Aqua Expurgo requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organ] Flower from a Plant (traditionally an Eldritch Lily)
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 382 (Third Party)

item.name: Bracers of Arc Lightning
item.text:
These bracers are crafted with fine leathers decorated with magical scales, washed in elemental fluids, elemental dust, and contaminated ichor. The animus used must be from a creature that deals Lightning damage, allowing the bracers to channel the element. While wearing these magic bracers you gain Resistance to Lightning damage and Immunity to the Shocked condition. These magic bracers have six charges, and regain all expended charges each day at dawn. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can expend one charge from the bracers to deal an extra 3d6 Lightning damage to the target. A target which takes this damage has the Shocked condition until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating bracers of arc lightning requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a creature that deals Lightning damage (such as a Blue Dragon) • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Hide] Skin • [Hide] Scales
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

item.name: Charged Gauntlets
item.detail: very rare (requires attunement by a monk)
item.text:
These light gauntlets are made from cloth woven from the hair of a fiend and reinforced with the scales of a dragon. The gauntlets are washed with an alchemical formula made from elemental fluid and undead dust. They are then powered with a rare animus collected from an aberration. Each time you hit with an Unarmed Strike while attuned to these magic gauntlets they gain one charge. The gauntlets can have up to 10 charges. Any unexpended charges disappear when you take a Long Rest or roll Initiative. While the gauntlets have at least one charge, your Unarmed Strikes deal Lightning damage instead of its normal damage type. While the gauntlets have 5 or more charges, your Unarmed Strikes deal an additional 2d6 Lightning damage and push the target 10 feet away from you on a hit. You can expend 2 charges from the gauntlets to cast the Shield spell. You can expend 10 charges from the gauntlets to cast Destructive Wave or Wall of Force, using your monk's focus saving throw DC.
Crafting. Creating Charged Gauntlets requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Aberrant Animus • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hair] Hair from a Fiend • [Hide] Scales from a Blue or Bronze Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

item.name: Charm of Swarms
item.text:
This charm resembles a large gnat. It is made of the spores of dead mushrooms; the mandibles of an insectoid creature are placed upon it. The charm is coated in an acidic bile and held together by dried mucus. It smells of bugs and rot. When an enemy within 5 feet of you scores a Critical Hit on an attack made against you, you can cause the enemy to become Burning (2d6 Necrotic). While the target is Burning in this way, you have Advantage on attacks against the target.
Crafting. Creating a Charm of Swarms requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Acidic Bile • [Fluid] Mucus • [Natural Weapon] Spores • [Natural Weapon] Mandibles
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

item.name: Circlet of Valor
item.text:
This steel circlet is forged from a construct and set with a gemstone animus containing a fiend. After being cleansed in the fires of a dragon's breath, this holy circlet glimmers with radiant energy. When you cast a spell of level 1 or higher that restores Hit Points to a creature, that creature gains Valor (1d4) until the end of its next turn.
Crafting. Creating a Circlet of Valor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Fiend • [Dust] Any Dust • [Hide] Plates from a Construct • [Organ] Glands from a Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

item.name: Cold Snap Circlet
item.text:
This icy circlet is made from frozen contaminated ichor, kept in a state of permafrost by the heart of a naturally cold creature, and lined with frozen bones of undead, all powered by the animus of an elemental. Even in its permanently frozen state, it is comfortable to wear. Once per turn, when you cast a spell that deals Cold damage using a spell slot, you can choose one target that was dealt Cold damage by the spell to gain the Frozen condition. The escape DC equals your spell save DC.
Crafting. Creating a Cold Snap Circlet requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from an Elemental • [Bones] Ribs from an Undead • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organ] Heart from a White Dragon, Silver Dragon, Winter Troll, or any monster Immune to Cold damage.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

item.name: Crest of the Sacred Flame
item.text:
This crest is crafted from the compressed dust of fiends destroyed and sanctified by the Sacred Flame and torched in fires ignited by the elemental fluid taken from a dragon. This simple crest is made from the bones of undead creatures washed in acidic monster bile. While attuned to this magic crest you increase the Emanation of your Aura of Protection by 10 feet.
Crafting. Creating a Crest of the Sacred Flame requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Spine or Ribs • [Dust] Fiend Dust • [Fluid] Acidic Bile • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

item.name: Dazing Maul
item.text:
This hammer is made from giant bones and forged in undead dust. The bones are then stained with monster blood. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic hammer. When you score a Critical Hit with this hammer, the target is Dazed until the start of your next turn.
Heavy. You have Disadvantage on attack rolls with a Heavy weapon if it's a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn't at least 13 or if it's a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn't at least 13.
Two-Handed. A Two-Handed weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Crafting. Creating a Dazing Hammer requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones] Skull from a Giant • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood
Proficiency: martial, maul Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2024) p. 215

item.name: Dazing Warhammer
item.text:
This hammer is made from giant bones and forged in undead dust. The bones are then stained with monster blood. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic hammer. When you score a Critical Hit with this hammer, the target is Dazed until the start of your next turn.
Versatile. A Versatile weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property. The weapon deals that damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Crafting. Creating a Dazing Hammer requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones] Skull from a Giant • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood
Proficiency: martial, warhammer Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2024) p. 215

item.name: Electric Charge Ring
item.text:
This ring, composed of living lightning, is forged from elemental dust compressed into a gem around the lens eye of a construct, washed in the acidic glands of a monster before being set into an animus of an elemental. When you cast a spell using a spell slot that deals Lightning damage, choose one target that failed its first saving throw against that spell. That creature is Shocked until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating an Electric Charge Ring requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from an Elemental • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Organ] Eye from a Construct • [Organ] Glands
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Everhot Stew Pot
item.text:
This cauldron is made using the plated iron from a construct infused with the ash of an elemental. The animus used must be from a dragon which adds both control and potency to the latent elemental magics. The spoon used to stir the cauldron is carved from the bone of a magical creature. This cauldron can heat to boiling temperatures without requiring fire simply by being filled and stirred, and the stews and soups it produces are always delicious and hearty. During a Long Rest, you can cook enough stew to feed up to three creatures. All creatures who eat a stew from this pot gain 10 Temporary Hit Points. While a creature has these Temporary Hit Points, they gain Valor (1d4).
Crafting. Creating an Everhot Stew Pot requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Dragon • [Bone] Ribs from a Monstrosity • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Hide] Plates
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Familiar Figurine
item.text:
Once per day as a Magic action, you can use this finely-carved figurine to cast Find Familiar.
Crafting. Creating a Familiar Figurine requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones] Bones from a Giant • [Dust] Dust from an Elemental or Fey
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 385 (Third Party)

item.name: Ghost Sight Bow
item.text:
This bow is hand-carved carefully from the bones of a dryad and stained in the undead blood of vampires. Strung with the hair of a banshee with a powerful wraith animus is placed with-in the handle. Once the bow's crafting is complete, it fades from its physical form into a semi-corporeal form. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longbow. The bow produces its own spectral ammunition which deals Force damage instead of Piercing damage. The ammunition disappears when it hits or misses a target. While attuned to this weapon, you can use a Bonus Action to see into the Ethereal Plane and see all invisible creatures and objects until the end of your turn. Additionally, you can see through all walls and solid objects within 60 feet of you until the end of your turn. During this time, ammunition fired from this bow passes through solid objects, and you can target enemies within 60 feet of you with your ranged attacks, even if they are behind total cover. You can use this Bonus Action only if you haven't moved during your turn. After you use the Bonus Action, your Speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn.
Crafting. Creating a Ghost Sight Bow requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Undead Animus from a Wraith • [Bones] Skull from a Dryad • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Ectoplasm • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Undead • [Hair] Hair from a Banshee
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.
Proficiency: martial, longbow Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 386 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Giant Femur Club
item.text:
This club is made from the cleaned and polished femur of a giant, crafted finely into a usable two-handed club. Its tapered hilt is wrapped in stained leather. Fastened to the top of the club is a large troll skull with several monstrous teeth embedded into it like a bone morningstar, giving the weapon a grim appearance. The club is imbued with elemental power from the animus used to power the weapon, which causes it to crackle with elemental power. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic greatclub, and you have Advantage on attack rolls made against Giants. While attuned to this club you deal an additional 2d6 damage of the type associated with the elemental dust infused into it.
Crafting. Creating a Giant Femur Club requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Giant Animus from a Troll • [Bone] Skull from a Troll. • [Bone] Bone from a Giant • [Dust] Elemental Dust from a Troll • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Teeth from a Giant, Beast, or Monstrosity
The dust Component determines the additional damage the club deals. For example, dust from a Storm Troll deals Lightning damage. Eldritch Trolls cause the club to deal Necrotic damage.
Proficiency: simple, greatclub Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Gloves of Ratling Agility
item.text:
Your Dexterity score is 19 while you wear these ratling hide gloves. They have no effect on you if your Dexterity is 19 or higher without them.
Crafting. Creating Gloves of Ratling Agility requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Fur from any Ratling • [Hide] Skin from any Ratling • [Organ] Guts from any Monstrosity
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Greater Rejuvenation Potion
item.text:
When you consume this potion, you immediately gain the benefits of a Long Rest. Once you consume a Greater Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish 3d6 Long Rests.
Crafting. Creating a Greater Rejuvenation Potion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components.
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Any Giant • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Any Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Monster Blood from any Dragon • [Hair] Any Celestial • [Organ] Brain from an Aberration • [Organ] Heart from a Fiend
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Hag-Stitched Troll Hide Armor
item.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing this magic armor. This magic armor has 50 charges. It regains all expended charges each day at dawn. While wearing this armor and attuned to it, at the start of your turn you can expend between 1 and 10 charges from the armor (no action required). You regain 1 Hit Point for each charge expended in this way. If you take Acid or Fire damage while wearing this armor, it loses 1 charge for each point of Acid or Fire damage taken.
Crafting. Creating Hag-Stitched Troll Leather Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Giant • [Bones] Skulls of any two Trolls • [Fluid] Monster Blood from any Troll • [Fur] Stitches • [Hide] Skin of any Troll
Proficiency: medium armor Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 144

item.name: Hag-Stitched Troll Leather Armor
item.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wearing this magic armor. This magic armor has 50 charges. It regains all expended charges each day at dawn. While wearing this armor and attuned to it, at the start of your turn you can expend between 1 and 10 charges from the armor (no action required). You regain 1 Hit Point for each charge expended in this way. If you take Acid or Fire damage while wearing this armor, it loses 1 charge for each point of Acid or Fire damage taken.
Crafting. Creating Hag-Stitched Troll Leather Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Giant • [Bones] Skulls of any two Trolls • [Fluid] Monster Blood from any Troll • [Fur] Stitches • [Hide] Skin of any Troll
Proficiency: light armor Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 144

item.name: Hazewind Cape
item.text:
This crimson and gold hooded cape is fitted with the feathers of fallen Harpies and dyed in their blood, this grants the wearer some resistance to the songs of Harpies. The cape is then infused with the dust of a fey creature which grants it a powerful anti-charm effect powered by an animus. While wearing this cape, you have Advantage on saving throws against the Charmed and Frightened conditions.
Crafting. Creating a Hazewind Cape requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Harpy • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Harpy • [Hair] Feathers from a Harpy • [Hide] Skin
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

item.name: Heart String Harp
item.detail: instrument, spellcasting focus, rare (requires attunement by a bard)
item.text:
When played, this instrument reverberates with draconic whispers and enchantment that drift subtly within the notes that are struck, giving the music a sense of foreboding and palpable charm. Crafted from finely polished ivory and imbued with the animus of a fey creature, the true magic of this harp comes from the finely crafted strings made from combining the sinew of a dragon's heart chords and the hair of a fey, willingly given out of kindness. You can use this magical harp as a Spellcasting Focus for your Bard spells. While attuned to this item, you gain a +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC. When you cast an Enchantment spell of level 1 to level 5 that targets only one creature using this harp as the Spellcasting Focus, you can target a second creature within the spell's range.
Crafting. Creating a Heart String Harp requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Fey Animus • [Hair] Hair from a Fey* • [Natural Weapon] Horns or Teeth of any Fey, Monstrosity, or Dragon • [Organ] Heart from a Dragon
*At the Game Master's option, rather than being harvested from a slain fey, this hair must be willingly gifted by a fey creature.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

item.detail: instrument, spellcasting focus, rare (requires attunement by a bard)
item.text:
When played, this instrument reverberates with draconic whispers and enchantment that drift subtly within the notes that are struck, giving the music a sense of foreboding and palpable charm. Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

item.name: Helm of Burning Rage
item.detail: clothes, rare (requires attunement by a barbarian)
item.text:
This helm is forged in fires ignited with elemental dust, using plates from a construct and the heart of a red dragon. The plates are then soaked in elemental fluid before having an animus gem installed that contains the energy of a Fire Giant. While your Rage is active, you gain Resistance to Fire damage. In addition, once per turn, while you are Raging, when you hit a target with a Melee weapon that benefitted from your Reckless Attack feature, the target becomes Burning (2d4 Fire).
Crafting. Creating a Helm of Burning Rage requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Fire Giant • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Plates • [Organ] Heart from a Red Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

item.name: Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma
item.text:
Structured from the fur and skin of a monstrosity and the horns of a fiend, and coated in the dust of fey creatures, this mantle is imbued with charming energies. Your Charisma score is 19 while you wear this magic cape. It has no effect on you if your Charisma is 19 or higher without it.
Crafting. Creating a Mantle of Otherworldly Charisma requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Fur from a Monstrosity • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Horns from a Fiend • [Dust] Fey Dust
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.name: Manual of Occult Anatomy +1
item.text:
Filled with diagrams showing humans with alien features, this book of strange medical lore is written in monster-blood ink infused with draconic dust and then etched onto parchment pages made from aberration skin. The manuscript is bound in a scale-clad cover. You can use this manual as a Spellcasting Focus for your Apothecary or Warlock spells. When you use the manual as a Spellcasting Focus, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs of your Apothecary or Warlock spells. In addition, the book contains the knowledge of an Apothecary Esoteric Theory or Warlock Eldritch Invocation up to 6th level and chosen when the item is created, which you gain while you are attuned to it. This determines which class is required to attune to the item.
Crafting. Creating a Manual of Occult Anatomy requires a Workshop and Components of equal rarity to the item created. The Components required are:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Any Dragon Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Monstrosity • [Hide] Scales • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.text:

item.name: Mask of Monstrous Forms
item.text:
This magic mask is made from the skull of a particular monstrosity (with a Challenge Rating of 6 or lower). The skull is carved into a mask, engraved with aberrant dust, and then boiled in a vat of mimic mucus, the flesh of a doppelganger, and acidic bile. Finally, a vessel containing the animus of any creature with the Shapechanger trait is placed upon the forehead of the mask, channeling its shapechanging magic. While attuned to the mask, you can expend two uses of your Wild Shape feature to transform into the monstrosity associated with the mask, instead of a Beast.
Crafting. Creating a Mask of Monstrous Forms requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a creature that has the Shapechanger trait • [Bones] Skull of a Monstrosity* • [Dust] Aberrant Dust • [Fluid] Acidic Bile • [Fluid] Mucus from a Mimic • [Organ] Flesh from a Doppelganger
* The Monstrosity used for this mask determines the form of the shapechange.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 389 (Third Party)

item.name: Pelt of the Pack Lord
item.text:
This pelt cape is made from the fur of a Garmyr stitched carefully into the leathers of a ratling, decorated with the talons of a harpy, and polished to a shine with contaminated ichor. While you are attuned to this pelt and are within 5 feet of a hostile creature, your allies have Advantage on attack rolls against that creature.
Crafting. Creating a Pelt of the Pack Lord requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Monstrosity Animus • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Hair] Fur from a Garmyr • [Hide] Skin from a Ratling • [Natural Weapon] Claws from a Harpy
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party)

item.name: Pendant of Prismatic Protection
item.text:
The jewelled pendant has 3 charges, which are replenished when you finish a Long Rest. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage, you can use a Reaction to expend 1 charge from the pendant to gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating a Pendant of Prismatic Protection requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] any Animus from an Elemental • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] any two Elemental Fluids from different Elementals
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party)

item.name: Potion of Controlled Mutation
item.text:
This sickly-looking potion contains a writhing mass of tentacles that animate and uncomfortably crawl down the imbiber's throat when consumed. The taste is pungent and fishy, and results in the sudden outbreak of random, but temporary, mutations. When you consume this potion, you gain the effects of one randomly determined Mutation until you start a Short or Long Rest. You can roll on the Mutations table twice, choosing which mutation manifests. You don't gain any Contamination levels as a result of this Mutation. When the effect ends, your body returns to normal.
Crafting. Creating a Potion of Controlled Mutation requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Animus from an Aberration • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Organs] Any two Organs from an Aberration.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party)

item.name: Rat Tooth Dagger
item.detail: dagger, rare (requires attunement by a rogue)
item.text:
When you hit with an attack as part of an Attack action using this magic dagger and apply your Sneak Attack to the damage roll, you can make an additional attack using this dagger as part of the same action. If that attack hits and meets the criteria for your Sneak Attack, you can apply half your Sneak Attack dice (rounded down) to the attack's damage.
Crafting. Creating a Rat Tooth Dagger requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Venom • [Hide] Bark • [Natural Weapons] Claws from a Ratling
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Thrown: If a weapon has the Thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the Finesse property.
Range: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.
Proficiency: simple, dagger Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Reflector Shield
item.text:
This magic shield is formed from the shell of an Anomollusk combined with leather from an aberration as its handle. It's fused together and coated in contaminated ichor and inset with a rare animus. Once complete, the shell gives off an otherworldly hue that shimmers in kaleidoscopic patterns. The shield can reflect attacks and magic. When you take Acid, Cold, Fire, Force, Lightning, or Thunder damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to cause the creature to take the same damage (you still take the damage).
Crafting. Creating a Reflector Shield requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Hide] Shell from an Anomollusk • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration
Proficiency: shield Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 144

item.name: Rejuvenation Potion
item.text:
When you drink this bright purple potion, you immediately gain the benefits of a short rest. After you consume a Rejuvenation Potion, you can't benefit from consuming another until you finish a 1d4 Long Rests.
Crafting. Creating a Rejuvenation Potion requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Any Elemental Fluid • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Dragon • [Organ] Heart from a Fiend
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 391 (Third Party)

item.name: Retracer Boots
item.text:
These boots are crafted from the flesh and scales of a dragon and decorated with Harpy feathers and the webbed membranes of flying creatures. The soles are injected with goopy ooze, allowing their wearer to jump back in time and space. You can use a Bonus Action on your turn to click the heels of these boots together. When you do, you teleport to the space you occupied at the start of your turn so long as it is currently unoccupied.
Crafting. Creating Retracer Boots requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Goopy Ooze • [Hide] Scales from a Dragon • [Hide] Webbed Membrane • [Hair] Feathers from a Harpy • [Organ] Flesh from a Dragon
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Scroll of Spell Power
item.text:
When you roll damage for a spell of level 1 or higher, you can expend this scroll to re-roll a number of the damage dice up to the level of the spell cast. You must use the new rolls.
Crafting. Creating a Scroll of Spell Power requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Fey, Dragon, or Giant • [Hide] Skin from a Monstrosity
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Scythed Arm Blades
item.text:
These steel arm blades are razor sharp, 4-foot-long scythes that are fastened to two locking bracers made of spinal bones. The fasteners are made from fine leather with steel buckles. Delerium crystals are embedded in the armbands, infusing the blades with energy. These magic shortswords function as a pair and must be wielded together for their magic properties to function. Attuning to the shortswords counts as being attuned to one magic item. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic shortswords. While attuned to these weapons, you can activate the Nick mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with these weapons.
Crafting. Creating Scythed Arm Blades requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Spine • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin from any Beast or Monstrosity • [Natural Weapons] Two Blades from a Reautomata
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Proficiency: martial, shortsword Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 215

item.name: Swashbuckler's Boots
item.text:
While wearing these supple leather boots, Opportunity Attacks against you have Disadvantage.
Crafting. Creating Swashbuckler's Boots requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Any
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 392 (Third Party)

item.name: Talon Gloves
item.text:
These leather gloves are outfitted with the talons of fallen beasts and stitched together with the arcane stitching of apothecary creations. The gloves are then empowered by elemental magic, reinforced with bone, and powered by an animus. While wearing these gloves, you gain Climb Speed equal to your Speed, and your Unarmed Strikes deal an additional 1d6 Piercing damage on a hit.
Crafting. Creating Talon Gloves requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hair] Stitches • [Hide] Skin • [Natural Weapons] Claws
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 393 (Third Party)

item.name: Tentacle Whip
item.text:
This whip is made from the tentacles and guts of aberrant creatures, stitched to the webbed membranes of winged beasts and fused to the bark of a plant creature. Once the animus is placed, the tentacles begin to writhe and wriggle and the whip can latch and drag creatures along the ground with uncanny strength. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic whip, which has a reach of 20 feet. Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller creature with an attack using this weapon, you can pull it 10 feet towards you.
Crafting. Creating a Tentacle Whip requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Hair] Stitches • [Hide] Bark • [Hide] Webbed Membrane • [Natural Weapons] Tentacles from an Aberration
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Reach: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it, as well as when determining your reach for opportunity attacks with it.
Proficiency: martial, whip Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 393 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149

item.name: Time Dilation Medallion
item.text:
The inner workings of this clockwork device are formed from gears forged from magical constructs gathered around a focusing lens, held together carefully by the needles of magical creatures. The animus used harnesses the energy of The Algorithm, a being of order and consequence, whose control over time and space ripples from the strange clockworks of the medallion. This medallion has 3 charges. It crumbles to dust when you expend the final charge. You can expend 1 charge from the medallion to take an extra action on your turn. Each time you do, you can roll 1d6. On a 1, at the end of your turn, you become unstuck in time and space as the medallion casts the Maze spell on you. On a 6, the medallion regains 1d3 charges.
Crafting. Creating the Time Dilation medallion requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components:
• [Animus] Animus from The Algorithm* • [Hide] Plates from a Construct • [Natural Weapon] Any Needles • [Organ] Eye from a Construct
* At the Game Master's discretion, the animus could be any other Legendary Construct instead.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Trollblood Potion
item.text:
This potion is a bubbling, sickly, green-brown viscous soup that has the consistency of mucus. What appears to be the rotting eye of a troll floats in the potion. It smells acrid and nauseating and tastes even worse than it looks. When you drink this potion, for the next minute, you regain Hit Points at the start of your turn. The effects of this potion end early if you take Fire or Acid damage.
Crafting. Creating a Trollblood Potion requires a Rare workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Fey Animus • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Troll • [Organ] Eyes from a Troll
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Vampire Blood Potion
item.text:
This potion is a crimson-red bubbling brew that tastes distinctly of copper. When you drink this potion, you gain the following benefits for the next minute:
• You gain Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
• If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + half the damage taken, unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a success, you drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and the effects of this potion end.
• The effects of this potion end early if you take Radiant damage or enter sunlight.
Crafting. Creating a Vampire Blood Potion requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components. • [Animus] Undead Animus • [Dust] Undead Dust from any Vampire • [Fluid] Ectoplasm • [Fluid] Monster Blood from a Vampire
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Wand of Jinxes
item.detail: wand, rare (requires attunement by a warlock)
item.text:
This wand is carved from magical bark, with the hair of an undead creature in its core and finished in goopy ooze. Once per turn when you deal damage with a Warlock cantrip to a creature, you can make that creature Jinxed (1d4) until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating a Wand of Jinxes requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Goopy Ooze • [Hair] Hair from an Undead • [Hide] Bark
Jinxed: Roll the die indicated by the condition, such as "Jinxed 1d4" each time you make an attack roll or saving throw. Subtract the value on the die from the result.
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 394 (Third Party)

item.name: Wand of the Precocious Apprentice
item.text:
Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature using a cantrip while holding this wand, one target of that cantrip takes an extra 1d4 damage of type dealt by the spell.
Crafting. Creating a Wand of the Precocious Apprentice requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones] Bones from an Undead • [Dust] Fey Dust • [Fluid] Ectoplasm
Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 395 (Third Party)

item.name: Whirling Bonesaw
item.text:
This large greataxe is made from a blade taken off a Ripper and refitted into a housing made from the plates of constructs and reinforced with the rib bones of a monstrosity. The blade is equipped with a leather belt that connects to an elemental-fuelled motor powered by a Very Rare Animus. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Once on your turn when you hit a Bloodied creature using this weapon, you can make one additional attack with this weapon as part of the same action.
Crafting. Creating a Whirling Bonesaw requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Ribs • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin from any Monstrosity • [Natural Weapon] Blade from a Ripper
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Two-Handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
Proficiency: martial, greataxe Source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 395 (Third Party), Player's Handbook (2014) p. 149
